fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40742].
  {panel}

Trying to incorporate a Google spreadsheet or Draw document into Confluence via the Widget connector results in no document being displayed and no error message.


Workaround for Spreadsheet and Google Draw:  
* Enable Confluence HTML Macros by going to Confluence Admin > Add-ons > Select All Add-ons > Search for 'HTML', and finally the second HTML module of the Confluence HTML Macro add-on. *(Important note:  Enabling these macros can make your Confluence site vulnerable to cross-site scripting attacks. Please only enable if you trust your users.*)
* Create a page and add the HTML macro
* Create an iframe, replacing the URL with the correct document.
* {code:java}
<iframe src="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dxSPZ07MJaD6HqAC8yqB-10xGWfYflnv1xZR3_fc38/edit?usp=sharing" noborder="0" width="95%" height="800" scrolling="yes" seamless></iframe>
{code}

Workaround for Google Draw Image
* Navigate to Google Drive
* Edit the Doc
* Under File choose: Publish to the web
* Publish the document
* Click the Share button
* Copy the URL
* Insert a new image and paste the URL
fields.summary: Widget Connector does not work with Google Spreadsheets or Draw documents on Confluence 5.9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40740].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the Page Properties Report macro will not show results if used with a Page Properties macro that has a Page Properties ID that begins with zero (0)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page in Confluence and add the *Page Properties* macro
# Add a table (at least 2 columns) inside the macro (remove the header row and add data in each section of the table)
# Edit the *Page Properties* macro to add a Page properties ID that begins with ‘0’ (ex. 007)
# Add a label to the page and save the page
# Create another page and add the *Page Properties Report* macro
#* Enter the label from the previous page in the Label section
#* Expand the *Options* section and enter the Page properties ID from the other page that begins with ‘0’
#* Save the page

h3. Expected Results

We would expect that the information from the page properties macro would generate in the page properties report macro.  We can even see the correct information in the preview of the Page Properties Report Macro, but it does not render once saved.

h3. Actual Results
No information renders and a message 'No Content Found' is displayed
 
h3. Notes
This issue appears to have began in version 5.8.16.  This was working in Confluence 5.8.5 and 5.8.15.  This is not working in 5.8.16, 5.8.17,5.9.1,5.9.4
fields.summary: The Page Properties Report macro shows no results if corresponding page properties ID begins with '0'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40738].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Backup created from Cloud instance cannot be restore if it contains audit logs


h3.Step to replicate:
# Ensure that there are entries in the [Audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/audit-log-802164269.html]. If there is no entries in the audit logs, try to make some modication to the user to create a few entries.
# Create a backup from Cloud
# Restore the backup to the latest OD version 6.0.0-OD-2016.06.1-0009

h3. Expected Result
The backup successfully restore.

h3. Observed Result
The backup fail to restored with error similar to the following:
{code}
2016-02-10 11:29:16,745 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask] runInternal Failure during import
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/admin/restore-local-file.action | url: /longrunningtaskxml.action | traceId: a172a52c7cd939d9 | userName: admin | action: longrunningtaskxml
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: For input string: "2016-02-08 19:54:35.123"
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEntities(BackupImporter.java:400)
{code}
The issue seem to be cause by entries from {{auditrecord}} table. 

h3. Workaround 1
Manually delete all the object related to  {{com.atlassian.confluence.impl.audit}} package from the entities.xml in the backup

h3.Workaround 2
Create a support ticket in support.atlassian.com to request our Cloud Support Engineer to create a backup without the data from the following table since they have references against each other:
* audit_affected_object
* audit_changed_value
* auditrecord
fields.summary: Restore from Cloud fails with com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: For input string:
automatic sorting of "meeting notes" into months/years

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40733].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new Space
# Create a User Created Template from Space > *Space tools* > *Template* > *Create New Template*
# Create a Test page in the space and insert the *Create from template* macro and choose template created in step 2.
# Create a page by clicking on the "Create From Template" button - success
# Export the space to XML.
# Delete the Space.
# Import the Space into the same Confluence version.
# Rerun Content Index
# Create a page by clicking on the "Create From Template" button.

*Expected result*
A page with the user created template will be created.

*Actual Result*
The create window loading blank.

*Workaround*
Edit the *Create From Template* macro in the test page (step 3) and re-selecting the template resolves the issue.

*Notes*
The bug only persist when the User created template is created through  Space > *Space tools* > *Template* > *Create New Template*. This means that the bug didn't exist if the user created template is created from *General Configuration* > *Global Templates and Blueprints* > *Add Global Page Template*.
fields.summary: Confluence Create from Template macro with User created Space template did not work after Space import.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40729].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
This improvement request is related to bug [CONF-39539|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39539].
As of now, file conversion process for file preview will only be triggered once the user tried to preview the file. Depending on the document that needs to be converted itself, on the first attempt to preview the file, this feature then would not work correctly as the file conversion process has not been completed (users are only allowed to download the attached document).  

h3. Suggested Solution
To trigger the file conversion process when the file is attached to the page itself instead of on the first file preview attempt.
fields.summary: To Trigger File Preview File Conversion on Attaching File Attempt

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40720].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Users in Firefox attempting to use Office Connector Plugin receive message:
{quote}Please configure the Office Connector plugin to allow authentication tokens in the URL path{quote}

In Cloud, users do not have {{sysadmin}} access, therefore, cannot update this setting.

h3. Environment
* Most recent stable release of Firefox (44 as of this ticket)
* WebDAV Launcher version 1.1.0
* Replicated with Windows 7 Pro, as well as 8.1 so far.
-- Confluence is 6.0.0-OD-2016.05.1-0005
-- Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.06.1-0009

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Locate an Office Document within Confluence and attempt to edit either from:
- Page Attachments > Edit in Office
- Clicking the "Edit Document" for an Embedded Office Doc
 
h3. Notes
- Perhaps was as of an update of WebDAV launcher 1.1.0
- Attempted the same with Open Office, but still receive an error
- One user has mentioned they can still use the feature but get the error.

h3.Workaround
- Browsers besides FireFox work fine
- Partial Workaround:
-- Edit the WebDav Launcher option within Firefox Extensions and delete the Application Path
-- This seems to allow the Office Doc to open, but not for subsequent edits. 

Note:

This fix for this issue is released in Confluence 5.9.7. However, if the customer still experiences this issue, please collect the following information,

- Confluence version
- Firefox version
- MS Office version. Microsoft Office 2010 SP2 or later should be installed in order to using this feature. Furthemore, please check whether Microsoft Lync is installed if Microsoft Office 2010 SP2 is used.
- the WebDAV Launcher configuration, the mapping from ext to the application path
do all users experience the same error?
fields.summary: In Firefox, using edit in Office feature results in authentication token error
Provide a usable Confluence look and feel while accessing Confluence in High Contrast Black Theme/Invert Colour with high contrast
Accessing base URL causes 302 redirection
can't access account

h3. Problem Definition
As an administrator, I would like to be able to bulk update the properties for the Code Block Macro. At the moment, the only way to do this natively through the front end is to update each page where the macro is included manually.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40689].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you create a child page of a page that has not saved (created) yet by using [ my new page ] syntax and open the link. It would redirect you to a page that is a child of the homepage of space. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page inside a page that has restrictions. 
# Typed in [ my new page ], right-click on the link and click *Go to link*.
# The new page would then be a direct child of the Space Homepage. 
# Click Save. 

h3. Expected Results
* It should not be possible to create a page by using [ my new page ] syntax and create a page direct children of the homepage - it should be a child of the new page.

h3. Actual Results
It is possible to create a page by using [ my new page ] syntax and create a page direct children of the homepage
fields.summary: Creating a page from an unsaved page breaks space permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40688].
  {panel}

Documented at:

https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/search/v2/lucene/boosting/BoostingStrategy.html#boost(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader,%20com.atlassian.confluence.search.service.SearchQueryParameters,%20int,%20float)

Implementations of BoostingStrategy always see searchQueryParameters as null.

I did some tracing and found that it originated at null being passed into BoostingQuery in DefaultCQLSearchService:26 . [~slancashire] has some familiarity with this code.

I believe this bug was introduced with CQL.

Support request: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-167803

Steps to reproduce:

# Install searchboost.zip plugin to connie instance (it's just an example implementation of BoostingStrategy)
# Do basic confluence search
# Observe  searchQueryParameters is null when the Booster is invoked

We need to either update the documentation, remove the property, or update the code to create a searchQueryParams from the CQL.
fields.summary: searchQueryParameters argument is always null in BoostingStrategy
Create an Email Template Editor in the UI
Update Supported Platforms page regarding Solaris derivatives

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40682].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When creating a page based on a template that have variables, we need to enter the values for those variables. However, once we are able to enter text in the body of the created page, it's not possible the use the variables any longer.


h3. Case Scenario
# Create a template with variables $manager and $dueDate.
# Once I create a page based on this template, I enter "Eduardo Mallmann" for the $manager variable and "05-05-2016" for $dueDate.
# Now that I'm writing the body content of this page, instead of entering the name of my manager and the due date manually, I should be able to use the variables $manager and $dueDate.

*Example*
_Produce release notes $manager with the project due date $dueDate_
This would generate the following text:
_Produce release notes Eduardo Mallmann with the project due date 05-05-2016._
fields.summary: Option to Use Template Variables After Creating the Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40681].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding an image link in the site welcome message, the clickable are for the link spans the entire section, as opposed to just the image area.

h3. Environment
Tested in Confluence 5.8.17, and 5.9.4 (using the old dashboard)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to !https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/2041359/oZYNLidcDNI3S8o/Dashboard%20-%20Confluence%202015-05-13%2013-43-47.png! *-> General Configuration -> Global Templates and Blueprints*
# Edit the 'Default Welcome Message'
# Add an image to the editor, click on the image and click on 'Link'
# Enter any external/internal URL
# Go back to your dashboard

h3. Expected Results
The image can be clicked to take the user to the link

h3. Actual Results
The image is clickable but so is the entire width of the welcome message panel. In the image below, you can see that the entire area in the red box can be clicked and will take users to the URL:
!clickable.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
I have been unable to find a workaround so far. This can maybe be fixed through the global layout for the dashboard, or using custom CSS.
fields.summary: Image links broken in 'Welcome Message' layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40680].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Long string of text doesn't wrap and is cut off.

h3. Environment
* Only reproducible in comments in Chrome Version 48.0.2564.82 (64-bit), Firefox 43.0.4, Safari Version 9.0.1 (11601.2.7.2).  
* Originally reported in confluence questions but happens in confluence as well. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter a comment with a long string of text in a comment i.e.
{noformat}
wwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdlwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdlwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdlwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdl
{noformat}
!pdg.png|thumbnail!
# Comment text is cut off based on window size instead of wrapping. 

h3. Expected Results
Comment will wrap as it does in JIRA comments according to window size. 
h3. Actual Results
Comment text is cut off and doesn't wrap.
fields.summary: Long string of text does not wrap in comments.
As an admin I want to configure the color used for inline comment highlighting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40675].
  {panel}

I am creating pages using the REST APIs POST to /rest/api/content filling them automatically with preliminary content. 

Before really releasing the page to the public I'd like to manually review it and tweak it. Only after that I want to release it.

However, when using the above mentioned REST API POST the page is available to the public immediately. All space watchers are informed and I have no chance to review it before releasing.

When doing it manually I can create the page and during editing I can restrict access to myself until the content is fixed and ready for release.     

I'd like to have a way to hand over the access restriction together with the call to create the page so that I can silently create a new page and watchers are not notified.
fields.summary: Create confluence page with access restriction using the REST API
No one is actively answering under Atlassian Answers, need revamp, and need more enthusiastic things to go on in Atlassian answers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40672].
  {panel}

Confluence File Preview does not allow setting custom size for SVG format

How to reproduce :

# Create a new page
# Upload .SVG image format
# Insert the .svg image using ! insert image macro 
# Resize image in a specific width using the custom setting option

h3. Actual behavior:
The image is broken or not showing properly

h3. Expected behavior:
The image should display with the custom size


h3. Workaround
Make the svg 301px large or bigger.  It only breaks for sizes below 301px.
fields.summary: Confluence File Preview does not allow setting custom size for SVG format

https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Artifactory+REST+API#ArtifactoryRESTAPI-Example-DeployinganArtifact

In the curl sample below, you shall use  'my-repository' and 'my/new/artifact/directory/'.

curl -u myUser:myP455w0rd! -X PUT "http://localhost:8081/artifactory/{color:red}repoName/dir/file.txt{color}" 
-T Desktop/myNewFile.txt

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40665].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The upgrade task for Roadmap macro creates entry in Page history using the name of the original page creator even the user was disabled long time ago.

h3. Suggested Solution
There could be 3 workable solutions:
1. Don't make the logging regarding an update of the plugin.
2. Create a possibility to make a 'system' logging - that is a make that the system has made changes.
3. Log a system administrator as the changer.
fields.summary: [Roadmap macro] Upgrade task create the new entry in page history with the name of creator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40653].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence administrator, I would like for the Confluence profile picture size limit to be higher as most smartphones in present day will take pictures that are greater than 2000x2000px. This limitation seems to affect mobile users consistently.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Allow configuration of profile image size limit by administrators
# Increase the current size limit

Decrease the image size to less than 2000x2000px before re-uploading as a profile image.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40647].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no possibility to hide rows in a table in Confluence. This can cause issues if the table is particularly large.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to hide rows in a table to save load time.

Was previously requested in 2011 in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-20098 but was closed.

h3. Workaround
Install [Table Filters and Charts for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.stiltsoft.confluence.plugin.tablefilter.tablefilter/cloud/overview]
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to hide or collapse rows in a table.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40646].
  {panel}

Confluence converts labels to  lower-case, while JIRA maintains the original case of the label as it was entered.

E.g. in JIRA I have 'DevOps', 'DoD', ... and in Confluence this becomes 'devops', 'dod', etc.

* Would be nice if Confluence would act similar to JIRA and keep the case I specify.
* Would be great if there was a way to synchronise labels between JIRA and Confluence so one does not have to enter them twice (synchronization on/off could be a config setting)
fields.summary: Make labels case-sensitive in Confluence just like in JIRA (or sync labels altogether)
Confluence Scheduled Space Backup
Allow users to add label to attachments before they added via drag and drop feature
Ability to choose file names from the list in Gallery Macro
Add system property to allow for whitelisting domain(s) when clickjacking protection is disabled
Increase time-out threshold

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40636].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When exporting a page to PDF, Confluence should show a popup where the user could select some custom settings like the page layout: Portrait or Landscape.

Many pages don't fit on a portrait layout and the content is cut. Having the possibility to export using landscape mode should solve this problem.
h3. Workaround

Customize Exports using CSS. See [Customize Exports to PDF|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/customize-exports-to-pdf-724764825.html]
fields.summary: Export to PDF Layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40634].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Index snapshots are currently stored (and being compressed) on the shared home folder of Confluence Data Center. The compression process uses significant disk I/O, that may affect the cluster performance negatively, possibly causing service degradation.

h4. Proposed solution
Allow administrators of large instances to specify different filesystems for the snapshots, to better manage disk utilization and make sure that packing the index snapshots is performed on a local filesystem (local home).
fields.summary: Allow for Data Centre index snapshots to be created in an alternative location

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40630].
  {panel}

* Upload an Image Attachment multiple times so it has more than one version
* Embed the image to a page and add a comment to the image (using the file viewer UI)
* Go to the attachments page and delete any single historical version of this attachment

This has two impacts:
* It will incorrectly unindex all comments (and attachments although this is rarely seen) from all versions of the content in the edge index.  This has the impact that attachment comments will fall off the popular stream tab of the dashboard (even for versions that still exist).
* Its extremely slow and gets slower and slower depending how many attachment versions you have.

The fix:
* Only unindex the child information of the attachment version being deleted
fields.summary: Deleting Attachment Version unindexes all Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40628].
  {panel}

Confluence text editor removes formatting when deleting a row.
h4. How to reproduce:
# Create a new page
# Create a row with paragraph format and type 'paragraph text'.
# Press enter twice to create blank row or blank space line
# Create a row with heading 1 formatting and type 'heading 1 text'
# Save the page
# Edit page
# Put the editor cursor to the blank row and press delete key.

h4. Actual behavior:
Row with heading 1 formatting moved up 1 row and drop its formatting
h4. Expected behavior:
The row with heading 1 formatting should retain its formatting after deleting the blank row.
fields.summary: Confluece text editor removes text formatting when deleting a row
Default Attachments Template / Global Attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40626].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there isn't a method via the UI to view space permissions and page restrictions for all the spaces and pages in your confluence instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Create a built in UI report that uses [Confluence rpc and soap calls|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-rest-api/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis] to pull the info into a nice GUI report. Also perhaps add a permission helper similar to the one in JIRA. 

h3. Workaround

In cloud there isn't one as soap and rpc remote calls are [restricted in confluence cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/restricted-functions-in-confluence-cloud-734070955.html]. However this would work in BTF.
fields.summary: Provide ability to quickly audit permissions via a confluence permissions report.
Provide progress bar for Confluence to monitor upgrade process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40623].
  {panel}

h2.First Symptom

When a user watch a space, and configured only receive a daily email report summarising all changes that you have permission to view, but receiving changes of every content instead of summary




*Steps to replicate*
* Install a new confluence 5.8.16
* Configure a mail server with GMAIL
* Go to profile, setting, [Email setting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/email-notifications-145162.html]
* Uncheck all option but {{Subscribe to daily updates}}
!setting.JPG|thumbnail!
* Watch a space
!watch.JPG|thumbnail!
* Login *as other user*, make some changes, or create some new page on the watched space

*Expected Behavior*

Receiving a daily summary only

*Actual Behavior*

Receiving email from every changes of the space, included the changed content of the page
!email.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Subscribe to daily updates not working, receiving a show changed content email instead.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40621].
  {panel}

Hi guys. 

I hope this is the correct project to raise this issue. I was going to raise it against Connect, but that's on EAN and I don't have access right now. Please feel free to move it if required.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a connect add-on listening to the "page_updated" webhook event.
# Create a page which contains a link to another page.
# Delete the page containing the link.
# Edit and rename the other page (which was linked to by the now-deleted page)

*bug* A webhook page_updated event is fired for the deleted page. Whilst this may seem useful, it just causes confusion as requesting the URI for the page returns a 404. 

Cheers.

~Dave
fields.summary: Webhook event is fired for Trashed page

  {panel}

Customer is not able to search for issues on Confluence on edit mode anymore.

Steps to reproduce:

Instance presenting the issue: https://profoundmedical.atlassian.net

1. Insert a JIRA issue into a large Confluence page (CTRL+SHIFT+J...) and note the inserted issue's key
2. Save the page
3. Reopen the page for edit
4. Use CTRL+F with the key of JIRA issue from #1 

Please investigate

Thanks and regards,
Bernardo | Atlassian Cloud
fields.summary: Impossible to search for JIRA issues on Confluence page in edit mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40615].
  {panel}

Hi,
Just a quick one!
After creating an Epic in our Jira project I frequently received questions on what the priority of the issues within it should be, however each of the issues had their own priorities assigned to them if users had taken the time to check - so it dawned on me that a useful feature would be including, ideally, the ability to select which data to show in the Epic's table of issues, or failing that at least show the priority column within that table.  If this is deemed a good suggestion could I ask that it's implemented for Jira Cloud.
Hopefully that's clear, cheers and good work!
- A
fields.summary: Show selectable columns in Epics
Typo in example code
Temporary lack of migration from Confluence Cloud to Server for instances that have opted-in for collaborative editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40611].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start a Cloud instance with JIRA Core (_not_ Software) and Confluence.
# Create a project in JIRA and Confluence.
# Add a new issue in JIRA.
# Create a page in Confluence and add the JIRA issue above in with a JIRA Issues Macro.
# Click on the "1 JIRA issue" link at the top of the page.

h3. Expected results
The user sees the linked JIRA issue and that's all.

h3. Actual results
The user _does_ see the linked JIRA issue, but also an error saying "Unable to retrieve JIRA metadata. One or more application links have not been configured correctly.":

!error.png!

h3. Notes
This doesn't interfere with the operation of the JIRA links dialog, they're all tracked correctly, it's just not a good user experience.

This is coming from the confluence-jira-metadata plugin. It hits several endpoints in JIRA, but the one that's causing problems is {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/api/sprints/remotelink}} which is returning a 403 and the error "You currently don't have access to perform this operation".
fields.summary: Confluence returns "Unable to retrieve JIRA metadata" message in linked JIRA issues dialog when linked JIRA is Core-only or JSM-only rather than Software
Ability to change group for "Contact Administrator" feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40609].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The thumbnails in the 'Attachments' macro do not appear on a published page. However, they appear in the Edit  macro dialog and when previewing a page before saving it.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and attach images to it
# Edit page and add Attachment macro
# Hit preview on the macro 
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
Page should render the images attached
h3. Actual Results
Nothing is showing
 
h3. Workaround
Click the View/Preview button to open the Attachment in the Lightbox Preview
fields.summary: Attachments macro preview broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40585].
  {panel}

h3. Summary.
The  PDF/Word page export does not display the second page of the Task Report macro. For example, if you have 23 task in the task report  macro, you will get 2 page. When the page is exported to PDF/Word, only the first page (first 20 entry) will be displayed.

h3. Step to replicate
# Create 22 task in a space
# Create a Task Report macro in a page to display all those task
# Export the page with the Task Report Macro to PDF or Word

h3. Expected Result
All the task from the task Report Macro are exported to the PDF or Word

h3. Observed Result. 
Only the first 20 task from the first page of the Task Report Macro are exported to the PDF or Word

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40583].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When searching for the content of any Expert macro, the results may be displayed as a page preview of the excerpted content (an option similar to the one available in Livesearch macro, which you can search for page excerpt).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Insert Excerpt macro in a page. Write "test" in the Excerpt macro.
# Search for "test" using Confluence Search.

h3. Actual Results

It'll result the page in which the Excerpt macro is included in.

h3. Suggestion

To have the Excerpt macro content resulting in Confluence global search.
fields.summary: Ability to enable Excerpt macro content in Confluence Search results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40582].
  {panel}

Hello,

It happens to me a lot when I am editing or adding a page, that at the same time I think of a colleague that I want to share the page with. So that he/she sees that I've added a page or that I wanted him to know about this (and future information) 

Therefore it would come in handy that in Edit-modus, you can add a watcher, so when you save the page, the colleague gets informed instantly.

I think it's the best place to add it next to the icons from label/restriction. I think an extra icon, in green or someting, would definately be clear to see. 

Hope you can have a look into this :)
fields.summary: Add a watcher while editing / adding a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40579].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When viewing a ‘Space List’ macro with ’Space Scope’ in ‘Categories’, switching categories is not updating the space lists, always showing the spaces for the first selected category.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 spaces (say ‘Space A’ and ‘Space B’)
# Add two _different_ categories for each space (Say category ‘A’ for ‘Space A’ and ‘B’ for ‘Space B)
#* Also, make sure these spaces only belong to one of these categories
# Create a page with a ‘Space List’ macro
#* When adding the macro, select ‘category’ in ’Scope of spaces’, leave the rest as default
# Save the page and open it
# In ‘View Spaces With Categories’ switch from category ‘A’ to ‘B’.

h3. Expected Results
The listed spaces should be updated to the ones using category ‘B’. In this case, ‘Space A’ should disappear and ‘Space B’ be shown.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing changes. No matter what category we select, the list of spaces is never updated.

Refreshing the page also doesn’t help, the category is switched back to the first one.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Space list macro is not updating categories when selected
How became jira system administrative?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40574].
  {panel}

The User List macro (also known as UserLister macro) documented in [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/user-list-macro-139546.html] does not work as expected on Confluence 5.9.x and later versions. It works perfectly fine on versions prior to Confluence 5.9 series.

h3. Expected Behavior
The User List macro returns a list of *online* users based on the preset group(s) if the "*_Display Online/Offline Users_*" parameter is flagged as "*true*". The list includes the user account you are logged into.

h3. Actual Behavior
The list does not return any users along with the message "*_No results were found for groups : confluence-administrators,confluence-users_*". In other words, all users fell under "*offline*" status regardless of the users' activity.
fields.summary: UserLister Macro Does Not Work As Expected
Wrong icons for copy table row and paste table row

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40568].
  {panel}

Strange issue.

I installed multi-excerpt macro. 

It was working.

I then noticed error when I would edit the multi excerpt: "Multiexcerpt "excerpt_name" not found. Note that nested multiexcerpt macros are not supported."

If I then saved - or cancelled - that edit, and saved - or "closed" the page without saving, I would get errors from then onwards on the source page (the one with the excerpt) and the include page (the one with the multi excerpt include).  FRUSTRATING

I then noticed if I did a page preview and saved it, it would fix the error. Weird.

This error, along with CONF-40499 means that I have wasted HOURS with simple attempts to display info from multiple pages on a summary page using page properties reports and/or multi-excerpt includes. now that I know a page preview will fix it I have a workaround but these two bugs need to be fixed for this system of excerpt/include, page properties/report to work!!
fields.summary: Multi Excerpt gives errors after it is edited; can only be fixed via page preview

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40559].
  {panel}

When a draft of a page fails to save, a popup is placed directly over the document editor tools. 

This is a suggestion to follow two approaches:

h5.Option One

Put this notification literally anywhere else. Just moving it down as few as 2 or 3 EM would allow the user to continue using the tools while the popup is in place. 

h5.Option Two

Allow the user to permanently disable this notification for a session.
fields.summary: Change Pop up Notification Behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40556].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Based on [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-connector-prerequisites-170493096.html#OfficeConnectorPrerequisites-EditingOfficefilesattachedtoapage] Office connector is only available for Windows XP, Vista, 7, and 8.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the most recent version of this platform working with Office Connector.
 
h3. Workaround 
- Some users are able to Open/Edit Office Documents using: Internet Explorer 11 with Office 2013 on Windows 10
- FireFox displays a message indicating that is requires the Office Connector plugin configured to allow authentication tokens in the URL Path; this is not something configurable in the Cloud Environment.
fields.summary: Support Windows 10 for Office Connector
Enable the use of Smart Querying on the JIRA Issues Macro
Can the HTML include macro be configured to use HTTP basic auth?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40546].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, the Office Connector should use the "Content Type" parameter instead of "File Name" to determine Office Connector Functions. When files are renamed and the extension on Office files is removed, the "View" button is not displayed.

Steps to reproduce: 
# Enable the Office Connector.
# Create a Blank Page with the Attachment macro. 
# Add an office attachment. 
# Save the page.
# Notice the Attachment macro will have the "View" button enabled.
# Once verified, open the Properties option from the Attachment Macro.
#  Remove the file extension from the *File Name* field and save. 
# Notice the *View* button is no longer present and when attempting to Edit in Office, it is also unresponsive.

h3. Suggested Solution
# The Office Connector should use the "Content Type" parameter instead of "File Name" in case end users change the File Name. The content type should be a constant identifier for Office files.
# Add better logging to indicate within the log files that the file extension is not a known one

h3. Workaround 
Add the file extension to the File Name.
fields.summary: As an admin, the Office Connector should use the "Content Type" parameter instead of "File Name" to determine Office Connector Functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40545].
  {panel}

the "recently updated"-list stopped to be updated. This is also shown in the dashboard "All Updates"-list. 
Only a manually Reindexi updates the list one time. Further edits, or creations after that will not be recognised. 
These steps I have already tried without any success.:
1. deleted the index-files; reboot server; manuall reindex
2. deleted plugins cache like described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+clear+Confluence+plugins+cache
3. added the 3 files from patch.zip of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39825
(but did not make changes on the database, because it is on our Oracle-Cluster)
;reboot server; manuall reindex

Please help. 

Regards, 
Bernhard Wessel
fields.summary: The dashboard "All Updates"-list with the 'recently updated pages' will not be updated
As a Roadmap Planner Macro user, I would like to be able to link dependency bars with the same or different swimlane to isolate dependencies
Allow for Non Working Days with Roadmap Planner macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40538].
  {panel}

We have customized the PDF Export with organization specific header/footer and it works when exporting a space but not when exporting a page.

I understand the workaround is to export a single page from the space-export tool, but that is not intuitive and does not make much logical sense UI-wise.

Our staff would like to export a page using the ... button on the page itself and have it include the header/footer.

Could we please have that implemented (maybe even offer an admin-configurable optional button to enable/disable the page-specific layout)?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Apply PDF Layout Configuration to page-export
